entries.title: 'Boats are burned': Inside McCarthy's victory
entries.description:
• LIVE: How the historic contest for the speaker's gavel came to an end
• Investigations the House GOP plans to run now

entries.title: Jeremy Renner celebrates 52nd birthday in the hospital after snowplow accident
entries.description: Jeremy Renner is celebrating his 52nd birthday with a message of gratitude to his medical care team. The actor is continuing to recover from injuries sustained in a snowplow accident.

entries.title: Real Madrid fields no Spanish players in its starting lineup in a LaLiga match for the first time ever
entries.description: It is one of the most famous Spanish clubs in the world, if not the most famous.

entries.title: Hakeem Jeffries officially becomes the first Black lawmaker to lead a party in Congress
How the Supreme Court can finally enter the 21st century
entries.description: Oral arguments resume at the Supreme Court next week, with student debt relief, immigration and labor relations among the cases on the agenda. The top US court will hear from some of the nation's finest attorneys on issues impacting the daily lives of Americans.

entries.title: Six journalists detained over footage that shows South Sudan president seemingly wetting himself
entries.description: Six journalists in South Sudan have been detained over the circulation of footage showing President Salva Kiir appearing to wet himself at an official event, the national journalists union said on Saturday.

entries.title: The first-ever vaccine for honeybees has been approved by the USDA
entries.description: The United States Department of Agriculture has approved the first-ever vaccine for honeybees to prevent American foulbrood disease, a fatal bacterial disease that can destroy honeybee colonies, officials say.

entries.title: 5 New Year's resolutions for your dog and cat
entries.description: You may be spending a good bit of time right now finalizing — and, of course, implementing — your resolutions for the new year. Congratulations! Focusing on a happy and healthy lifestyle is a huge investment in your future.

entries.title: Houston area man charged after allegedly kidnapping, assaulting Bumble date for 5 days
entries.description: A Houston area man has been charged with aggravated kidnapping after holding a woman he met on a dating app captive for five days around Christmas and physically assaulting her before she escaped, according to charging documents.

entries.title: David Beckham's son, Romeo, joins Premier League B team
entries.description: Romeo Beckham, son of former England captain and soccer icon David Beckham, has joined Premier League Brentford's B team for the rest of the season on a loan deal from MLS NEXT Pro club Inter Miami CF II.

entries.title: What happened to Rudy Giuliani? Two classic films help explain it
entries.description: My father, a lawyer, once told me he hated movies about the law. With one exception, they were always false in one way or another. Yet the exception spoke to him profoundly, to his years as a defense attorney in the civil courts of Texas. That was 1982's "The Verdict," starring Paul Newman, directed by Sidney Lumet with a screenplay by the playwright David Mamet. Newman plays an alcoholic ambulance chaser named Frank Galvin, who finds himself suddenly giving a damn about justice in the midst of a case that should have been open and shut.

entries.title: McCarthy strikes a deal to get speaker's gavel
entries.description:
• How McCarthy survived the House chaos
• The House has a speaker. What comes next
• Collins: Trump was not the reason the votes were changed

entries.title: Denver Nuggets game delayed again because of crooked rim
entries.description: Less than a week after a Denver Nuggets game was delayed because of a crooked rim, a Nuggets game was put on hold again because the same rim was bent.

entries.title: NFL Week 18 preview: Playoff spots on the line in final week of regular season
entries.description: The NFL family has waited on tenterhooks this past week on the health of Damar Hamlin as he continues to recover in hospital, but this weekend the show goes on and the final game week of the regular season still holds plenty of thrilling football.

entries.title: Venus Williams forced to withdraw from Australian Open with injury
entries.description: Venus Williams has withdrawn from the Australian Open due to an injury she sustained at the ASB Classic in New Zealand, tournament organizers announced via Twitter on Saturday.

entries.title: Western Australia in grip of 'devastating' flood emergency, PM says
entries.description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said on Saturday his government was ready to provide whatever support was needed to residents of Western Australia state as record-breaking floods isolated far-flung communities there.

entries.title: What we learned about the NFL in the aftermath of Damar Hamlin's cardiac arrest
entries.description: The NFL has experienced nothing quite like the last few days.

entries.title: Huge boa constrictor snake found in carry-on baggage
entries.description: The bizarre yet fascinating menagerie of animals detected by TSA agents in carry-on baggage at US airports carries on into 2023.

entries.title: Why now is the best time to book your 2023 vacation
entries.description: The year's off to a dramatic start with storms lashing the United States' West Coast, a renewed volcanic eruption in Hawaii, and January heat records in Europe that are forcing some ski resorts to close due to a lack of snow.

entries.title: New York authorities confiscated record-breaking amount of fentanyl drugs in 2022
entries.description: Authorities in New York seized record-breaking amounts of fentanyl powder and fake prescription pills laced with the potent opioid in 2022, according to two drug enforcement agencies.

entries.title: Ukraine says fighting continued Friday, despite Russian ceasefire
More extreme weather on tap for California
entries.description: California has been battered by heavy snow, damaging winds and flooding this week -- and now another round of storms is set to hit the West Coast this weekend.

entries.title: Iranian protesters executed and journalist arrested amid crackdown following protests
entries.description: Iran executed two men Saturday, according to state-affiliated Fars News, bringing to four the total number of people executed in relation to the protests that have swept the country since September.

entries.title: The House has a speaker. Here's what comes next
entries.description: Now that a House speaker has been selected following a dayslong stalemate and members have finally been sworn in, the chamber can look toward picking back up business and organizing GOP-led committees.

entries.title: Foodies left 'devastated' that Ronzoni will discontinue its beloved star-shaped pastina
entries.description: Stock up on your starry pasta while you can.

entries.title: Jack Ma to relinquish control of Ant group
entries.description: Chinese billionaire Jack Ma will no longer control Ant Group after the fintech giant's shareholders agreed to reshape its shareholding structure, according to a statement released by the company on Saturday.

entries.title: Damar Hamlin is able to breathe on his own and talk to teammates, giving the Buffalo Bills 'fuel' for this weekend's game
entries.description: Just four days after his stunning on-field cardiac arrest, Buffalo Bills safety Damar Hamlin is breathing on his own and speaking to family, physicians and teammates -- positive updates that Bills players say will bolster them in this weekend's matchup against the New England Patriots.

entries.title: If you adopt one of these cats, Frontier Airlines will throw in a free flight too
entries.description: Adopting an adorable kitten could now bring you the added bonus of a free airplane trip.

entries.title: Putin avoids Russia blame game -- for now -- after Ukraine attack
entries.description: It was New Year's Eve, one of the most cherished holidays in Russia. The recruits in President Vladimir Putin's war against Ukraine -- hundreds of them mobilized just months ago -- were billeted in makeshift barracks, a vocational school in the occupied city of Makiivka, in the Donetsk region. Next door was a large ammunition depot.

entries.title: Iowa woman believed to be the oldest person in the US dies at 115
entries.description: An Iowa woman who was believed to be the oldest person in the US died this week, according to a funeral home.

entries.title: Los Angeles Dodgers officially cut ties with pitcher Trevor Bauer who served 194-game suspension for violating MLB policies
entries.description: The Los Angeles Dodgers have officially cut ties with pitcher Trevor Bauer, the team announced Friday.

entries.title: Japan flight makes emergency landing after apparent bomb threat
entries.description: An airplane made an emergency landing in central Japan on Saturday morning after receiving an apparent bomb threat, public broadcaster NHK reported, citing police sources.

entries.title: Times Square machete attack suspect indicted on terrorism charges
entries.description: Trevor Bickford, the 19-year-old accused of attacking New York Police Department officers with a machete on New Year's Eve, was indicted Friday on more than a dozen charges, including several terrorism charges, prosecutors announced.

entries.title: What the return of Chinese tourists means for the global economy
entries.description: In the years before Covid, China was the world's most important source of international travelers. Its 155 million tourists spent more than a quarter of a trillion dollars beyond its borders in 2019.

entries.title: Carlos Alcaraz will miss the Australian Open due to injury
entries.description: Men's world No. 1 tennis player Carlos Alcaraz will miss this month's Australian Open due to a leg injury, the 19-year-old Spaniard said on Friday.

entries.title: Federal appeals court strikes down ban on bump stocks
entries.description: A federal appeals court on Friday struck down a ban on bump stocks, devices that essentially allow shooters to fire semiautomatic rifles continuously with one pull of the trigger.

entries.title: Violence between Mexican military, gang members after 'El Chapo' son arrest
entries.description: A Mexico City federal judge halted the extradition of Joaquin "El Chapo" Guzmán's son, alleged drug cartel leader Ovidio Guzmán, to the United States, a day after he was arrested in an intense operation in northern Mexico that led to the deaths of 29 people. CNN's Rafael Romo has the story.
